cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression / Potential Tropical Cyclone (below SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Florida Keys/southern peninsula today, then over the southeast Gulf of Mexico and toward the central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama coast (central U.S. Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from the Alabama–Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, LA including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas; Storm-surge watch MS/AL border to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings issued yet (watches only, west of Florida Keys)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida including the Keys, then the central Gulf Coast (MS-AL-eastern LA)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated 8" amounts forecast over S. Florida)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible (30–40 mph) during passage Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of South Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 inches with locally up to 8 inches; risk of urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls, lightning, reduced visibility and localized flooding could disrupt port operations
